Subject: Nigeria
Description: Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa.

Subject: Nigeria
Description: Nigeria's poverty rate may have increased to 42.5% in 2020, according to the World Bank.

Subject: Nigeria
Description: Nigeria ranks 102 out of 104 countries in the Chandler Good Government Index.

Subject: Nigeria
Object: Mo Ibrahim Index of African Governance
Description: Nigeria ranks 34 out of 54 countries in the Mo Ibrahim Index of African Governance.

Subject: Nigeria
Description: Nigeria ranks 154 out of 180 countries in the Transparency International Corruption Perception Index.

Subject: Nigeria
Description: Nigeria ranks 143 out of 163 countries in the Global Peace Index.

Subject: Nigeria
Description: Only 5.8% of the House of Representatives in Nigeria are female legislators.

Subject: Nigeria
Description: Only 7.3% of the Senate in Nigeria are female legislators.

Subject: Government of Nigeria
Description: The Government of Nigeria contributes to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals.

Subject: Government of Nigeria
Description: The Government of Nigeria addresses the goals of the National Development Plan.

Subject: Financial Sector Deepening Africa
Description: UNDP will engage in high-level policy advocacy through the United Nations Nigeria Policy Advisors group, economic analysis and forecasting to inform effective policy choices by all stakeholders.

Subject: Insurance Development Forum
Description: UNDP will engage in high-level policy advocacy through the United Nations Nigeria Policy Advisors group, economic analysis and forecasting to inform effective policy choices by all stakeholders.

Subject: Nigeria
Description: Development financing challenges faced by Nigeria have driven UNDP to partner with the government, European Union, International Monetary Fund (IMF), World Bank, and other primary stakeholders in supporting the development of a healthy financial ecosystem through an Integrated National Financial Framework (INFF) and related economic policy reforms and institutional changes.

Subject: Food and Agriculture Organization
Description: Partnerships will be deepened with the British Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO), United States Agency for International Development (USAID), UNICEF, World Bank, and Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), tapping into innovation, advocacy, and capacity-building abilities.

Subject: Nigeria
Description: Climate-security nexus hubs piloted in the northwest of Nigeria, in partnership with development partners like the governments of Norway and Germany, will be leveraged and scaled to foster resilience to shocks.

Subject: Nigeria
Description: Climate-security nexus hubs piloted in the northwest of Nigeria, in partnership with development partners like the governments of Norway and Germany, will be leveraged and scaled to foster resilience to shocks.

Subject: Energy Commission of Nigeria
Description: Collaboration between the Energy Commission of Nigeria and the Rural Electrification Agency for promoting risk-informed green and circular economic development through emission trading schemes, scaling up access to clean and affordable energy, enhancing de-carbonization, de-risking private investments and off-grid clean energy technologies for productive uses through blended finance, and focusing on rural populations, people affected by conflict or crisis, women and girls, people living with disabilities, and youth.
